summary: THE AXLES ON THE TRAILER ARE MOVED BACK TOO FAR SUCH THAT THE TONGUE WEIGHT OF THE TRAILER WHEN UNLOADED IS CLOSE TO OR EXCEEDS 1000 POUNDS. THE STANDARD HITCH AND RECEIVER ASSEMBLY ON NEW AUTOMOBILE'S HAS A 1000 POUND TONGUE WEIGHT. WHEN THE TRAILER IS NORMALLY LOADED, THE TONGUE WEIGHT EXCEEDS 1200 POUNDS.  IN ADDITION, THE 50 GALLON FRESH WATER TANK IS AS FAR FORWARD AS POSSIBLE IN THE TRAILER.  WHEN FULL, THIS ADDS MORE THAN 400 POUNDS TO THE TONGUE WEIGHT BRINGING THE TOTAL WEIGHT ON THE HITCH EXCEEDS OF 1600 POUNDS.  THE MANUFACTURER PROVIDES NO WARNING ON THIS POTENTIAL HAZARD.  THIS PROBLEM COULD CAUSE A CATASTROPHIC FAILURE OF EITHER THE HITCH, RECEIVER, OR AXLES OF SOME VEHICLES BECAUSE THIS ALSO CAN CAUSE THE GROSS AXLE WEIGHT LIMIT TO BE EXCEEDED ON MANY TOW VEHICLE.  WANDERER STOPPED PRODUCING THIS TRAILER MODEL, PROBABLY DUE TO THIS HAZARD, THOUGH THEY CONTINUE TO INSIST THERE IS NO PROBLEM AND WILL NOT PROVIDED ANY WARNING TO CONSUMERS.  *MR   *JB      DIMSII IVOQ ENTRY POSTED AFTER 12/12/02 CUT-OVER TO ARTEMIS---731264
